name: Hoya calycina
description: Hoya calycina 'Stargazer' is an epiphytic plant native to tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and features trailing or climbing stems (60-120 cm long) with thick, fleshy, waxy, dark green leaves and clusters of star-shaped, white to cream flowers. The flowers have a distinctive star shape with a waxy texture and often emit strong, pleasant fragrances, especially at night. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds tropical charm with its waxy, star-shaped flowers and trailing vines. It's popular among Hoya enthusiasts for its attractive flowers.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
